5 Units of Free Electives required. SCM150 workshops for Math/Science courses recommended for remaining units.

This is the default curriculum required for students who do not declare a concentration. Courses taken to meet a major support requirement cannot be double-counted in the concentration or general curriculum.

Select from the following: BIO321, BIO322, BIO323, BIO324, BIO329, BIO335, BIO336, BIO429; BOT313; MCRO224, MCRO402; MSCI324.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, D2, Upper-Division D, E, and GE Electives. Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after junior standing is reached (90 units).
Choose one of the following: BIO327, BIO363, BIO442; BOT326; MCRO436; MSCI300.

Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after junior standing is reached (90 units).

Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after junior standing is reached (90 units).

This is the default curriculum required for students who do not declare a concentration. Courses taken to meet a major support requirement cannot be double-counted in the concentration or general curriculum.

20 units of Upper Division electives required. See Catalog for course options. Minimum of 12 units of 400-level courses, and 8 units of 300-level courses. Consultation with advisor is recommended. Excess units applied to 'Approved Electives'.

Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Any GWR class or GWR exam can go here. Refer to current catalog for prerequisites.
